Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
Moxie
<language, music> A language for {real-time} computer music synthesis, written in {XPL}.
["Moxie: A Language for Computer Music Performance", D. Collinge, Proc Intl Computer Music Conf, Computer Music Assoc 1984, pp.217-220].
(1994-12-05)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Moxie \Mox"ie\, n. [fr. Moxie, a trade name for a beverage.] 1. energy; pep. [1913 Webster]
2. courage, determination. [1913 Webster]
3. Know-how, expertise. --MW10. [1913 Webster]
moxie n : fortitude and determination; "he didn't have the guts to try it" [syn: {backbone}, {grit}, {guts}, {sand}, {gumption}]
